com.hazelcast.nio.tcp

Class TcpIpConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hazelcast.nio.tcp.TcpIpConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Connection

    public class TcpIpConnection
extends Object
implements Connection
    The Tcp/Ip implementation of the Connection.

    A TcpIpConnection is not responsible for reading or writing data to the socket; that is task of the Channel.

    See Also:
    Networking

      • write

        public boolean write(com.hazelcast.internal.networking.OutboundFrame frame)
        Description copied from interface: Connection
        Writes a outbound frame so it can be received by the other side of the connection. No guarantees are made that the frame is going to be received on the other side.

        The frame could be stored in an internal queue before it actually is written, so this call does not need to be a synchronous call.

        Specified by:
        write in interface Connection
        Parameters:
        frame - the frame to write.
        Returns:
        false if the frame was not accepted to be written, e.g. because the Connection was not alive.

      • close

        public void close(String reason,
                  Throwable cause)
        Description copied from interface: Connection
        Closes this connection.

        Pending packets on this connection are discarded

        If the Connection is already closed, the call is ignored. So it can safely be called multiple times.

        Specified by:
        close in interface Connection
        Parameters:
        reason - the reason this connection is going to be closed. Is allowed to be null.
        cause - the Throwable responsible for closing this connection. Is allowed to be null.

      • setBinding

        public boolean setBinding()

      • getCloseCause

        public Throwable getCloseCause()
        Description copied from interface: Connection
        Gets the cause this Connection was closed. Can be null if no cause was given or if the connection is still active. It is purely meant for debugging to shed some light on why connections are closed. This method is thread-safe and can be called at any moment.
        Specified by:
        getCloseCause in interface Connection
        Returns:
        the cause of closing this connection.
        See Also:
        (), Connection.close(String, Throwable)

      • getCloseReason

        public String getCloseReason()
        Description copied from interface: Connection
        Gets the reason this Connection was closed. Can be null if no reason was given or if the connection is still active. It is purely meant for debugging to shed some light on why connections are closed. This method is thread-safe and can be called at any moment. If the connection is closed and no reason is available, it is very likely that the close cause does contain the reason of closing.
        Specified by:
        getCloseReason in interface Connection
        Returns:
        the reason this connection was closed.
        See Also:
        Connection.getCloseCause(), Connection.close(String, Throwable)
